meanings.definition: A small, quick look or glimpse.
meanings.sent1: I took a peepbo at the cute puppy in the window.
meanings.sent2: She caught a quick peepbo of the shooting star before it disappeared.
meanings.sent3: With a peepbo, she spotted the hidden treasure under the bed.
meanings.sent4: The peepbo of sunlight through the clouds was like a spotlight on the stage.
meanings.sent5: His peepbo at the mysterious figure left a lasting impression on him.

meanings.definition: To make a feeble, shrill sound.
meanings.sent1: The old door would peepbo whenever it opened slowly.
meanings.sent2: The kitten started to peepbo when it couldn't find its toy.
meanings.sent3: The teapot began to peepbo as the water inside started to boil.
meanings.sent4: The wind made the branches peepbo like a chorus of tiny birds.
meanings.sent5: Her laughter would peepbo through the room, bringing smiles to everyone.

meanings.sent1: He was known as a peepbo, always afraid of trying new things.
meanings.sent2: The little peepbo trembled at the sound of thunder.
meanings.sent3: The peepbo peeked out from behind the tree, scared of the loud noise.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a lost peepbo in the big city, unsure of where to go.
meanings.sent5: The movie character was portrayed as a peepbo, afraid of the dark.
